Description: Chess piece, made of ivory, carved and incised, with ring-and-dot ornamentation around base, ring-and-dot cruciform shapes on side and rounded projections at top; king or queen.
Curator's comments: Previously regarded as dating from 8th-9th century.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1909 / Catalogue of the Ivory Carvings of the Christian Era with Examples of Mohammedan Art and Carvings in Bone in the Department of British and Mediaeval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (227)
Phillips 1996 / Africa: The Art of a Continent (7.49)
Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.51, fig.3)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016, 28 Apr-21 Aug, BM Sicily exhibition 2014 18 Mar - 21 June, Doha, Qatar,The Museum of Islamic Art, Kings and Pawns: Board Games from India to Spain
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
